required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Safety Study Of Inhaled Insulin (CP-464,005, Inhaler) In Japanese Patients With Type1 or Type2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Uncontrolled Long-Term Safety Study Of CP-464,005 (Inhaled Insulin) In Japanese Patients With Type 1 Or Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: Assess the safety and toleration of CP-464,005 and Inhaler following 1-year (52 week) administration to Type 1 and Type 2 diabetes patients (non-smokers)

detailed_description.textblock: Pfizer announced in October 2007 that it would stop marketing CP-464,005. At that time recruitment for study, A2171105 was placed on hold. Nektar, the company from which Pfizer licensed CP-464,005, announced on April 9, 2008 that it had stopped its search for a new marketing partner. As a result, study A2171105 was terminated on April 10, 2008. Neither safety nor efficacy reasons were the cause of the study termination.

clinical_study.why_stopped: See termination reason in detailed description.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Monitoring Blood Glucose Levels: Change From Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: The Values of Hemoglobin A1c:Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 6, Week 12, Week 26, End of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The Value of Fasting Plasma Glucose:Change From Baseline
The Incidence of Hypoglycaemia at the Cumulative Doses of Inhaled Insulin
The Values of Forced Expiratory Volume at 1 Second:Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Beseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 6, Week 12, Week 26

secondary_outcome.measure: The Values of Forced Vital Capacity:Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 6, Week 12, Week 26, End of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: The Values of Forced Expiratory Volume at 1 Second/Forced Vital Capacity:Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 6, Week 12, Week26, End of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Insulin Antibody Levels : Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 6, Week 12, End of treatment

arm_group.description: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (DM) who has not yet treated by Insulin
Type 2 DM who has already treated by Insulin

intervention.description: Taken for 1 year (52 weeks) immediately before each meal (breakfast, lunch, and supper). Dose: adjusted based on the results of self-monitoring of blood glucose before each meal.
Taken for 1 year (52 weeks) immediately before each meal (breakfast, lunch, and supper). Dose: adjusted based on the results of self-monitoring of blood glucose before each meal.
Taken for 1 year (52 weeks) immediately before each meal (breakfast, lunch, and supper). Dose:adjusted based on the results of self-monitoring of blood glucose before each meal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have been diagnosed with Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes for at least 1 year, based on the diagnostic criteria for diabetes.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have smoked during the 6 months prior to screening (smoking shall be prohibited during the term of this study, as well)
- Patients exhibiting pulmonary function test (spirometry) abnormalities (FVC or FEV1 < 70% of predicted) ) at Week -4.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: As a result of Pfizer's decision (18 Oct 2007) to return the worldwide rights for CP-464,005 (insulin human [rDNA origin] Inhalation Powder) to Nektar, from which Pfizer licensed inhaled insulin technology, it was decided to terminate this study before it had recruited targeted number of subjects.

group.title: All Subjects With Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
group.description: All subjects with type 1 or type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with inhaled insulin in this study. This study was open-label, uncontrolled study and at all times in the trial, each subject had an individualized recommended insulin dose for each of the dosing times.

group.title: All Subjects With Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
group.description: All subjects with type 1 or type 2 diabetes mellitus treated with inhaled insulin in this study. This study was open-label, uncontrolled study and at all times in the trial, each subject had an individualized recommended insulin dose for each of the dosing times.

outcome.title: Daily Inhaled Insulin Dose
outcome.description: The mean of daily inhaled insulin dose. The dose of inhaled insulin was adjusted based on the results of self-monitoring of blood glucose before each meal.The end of treatment values were calculated each subject's last observed value up to 26 weeks.
outcome.population: Includes all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. Number of subjects with evaluable data presented as n=type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin, respectively.

group.title: Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
group.description: subjects with type 1 diabetes mellitus

group.title: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin
group.description: subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus who had already treated by Insulin

group.title: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin
group.description: subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus who had not yet treated by Insulin

measure.title: Daily Inhaled Insulin Dose
measure.description: The mean of daily inhaled insulin dose. The dose of inhaled insulin was adjusted based on the results of self-monitoring of blood glucose before each meal.The end of treatment values were calculated each subject's last observed value up to 26 weeks.
measure.population: Includes all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. Number of subjects with evaluable data presented as n=type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: The Values of Hemoglobin A1c:Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Hemoglobin A1c levels obtained each observation point minus that at baseline. The end of treatment values were calculated each subject's last observed value up to 26 weeks.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 6, Week 12, Week 26, End of treatment
outcome.population: Includes all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. Number of subjects with evaluable data presented as n=type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin, respectively.

measure.title: The Values of Hemoglobin A1c:Change From Baseline
measure.description: Hemoglobin A1c levels obtained each observation point minus that at baseline. The end of treatment values were calculated each subject's last observed value up to 26 weeks.
measure.population: Includes all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. Number of subjects with evaluable data presented as n=type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: The Value of Fasting Plasma Glucose:Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Fasting plasma glucose levels obtained at each observation point minus that at baseline. The end of treatment values were calculated each subject's last observed value up to 26 weeks.
outcome.population: Includes all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. Number of subjects with evaluable data presented as n=type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin, respectively.

measure.title: The Value of Fasting Plasma Glucose:Change From Baseline
measure.description: Fasting plasma glucose levels obtained at each observation point minus that at baseline. The end of treatment values were calculated each subject's last observed value up to 26 weeks.
measure.population: Includes all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. Number of subjects with evaluable data presented as n=type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: The Incidence of Hypoglycaemia at the Cumulative Doses of Inhaled Insulin
outcome.description: Number of hypoglycemic events per subject-month. Subject-month=(number of days from the first day of study treatment to the last day of active treatment + 1 day lag)/30.44
outcome.population: Includes all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. Number of subjects with evaluable data presented as n=type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin, respectively.

group.description: subjects with type 1 diabetes mellitus

group.description: subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus who had not yet treated by Insulin

measure.title: The Incidence of Hypoglycaemia at the Cumulative Doses of Inhaled Insulin
measure.description: Number of hypoglycemic events per subject-month. Subject-month=(number of days from the first day of study treatment to the last day of active treatment + 1 day lag)/30.44
measure.population: Includes all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. Number of subjects with evaluable data presented as n=type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Using Insulin, Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Not Using Insulin, respectively.

outcome.title: The Values of Forced Expiratory Volume at 1 Second:Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Pulmonary function test(forced expiratory volume at 1 second) obtained at each observation point minus that at baseline. The end of treatment values were calculated each subject's last observed value up to 26 weeks.
outcome.time_frame: Beseline, Week 1, Week 2, Week 6, Week 12, Week 26
outcome.population: Included all subjects who had a baseline forced expiratory volume at 1 second value, had at least one-post baseline forced expiratory volume at 1 second values, and received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: subjects treated with inhaled insulin

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: As a result of Pfizer's decision (18 Oct 2007) to return the worldwide rights for CP-464,005 (insulin human [rDNA origin]) Inhalation Powder) to Nektar, from which Pfizer licensed inhaled insulin technology, it was decided to terminate this study.
